InterventionReportBody.summary: NOTE Experimental The InterventionReportBody interface of the Reporting API represents the body of an intervention report.

remarks.para: An intervention report is generated when usage of a feature in a web document has been blocked by the browser for reasons such as security, performance, or user annoyance. So for example, a script was been stopped because it was significantly slowing down the browser, or the browser's autoplay policy blocked audio from playing without a user gesture to trigger it.

A deprecation report is generated when a deprecated feature (for example a deprecated API method) is used on a document being observed by a . In addition to the support of this API, receiving useful intervention warnings relies on browser vendors adding these warnings for the relevant features.

InterventionReportBodyColumnNumber.summary: NOTE Experimental The columnNumber read-only property of the interface returns the line in the source file in which the intervention occurred.

blockquote.para: This property is most useful alongside and as it enables the location of the column in that file and line where the feature is used.

InterventionReportBodyColumnNumber.value: An integer, or null if the column is not known.

InterventionReportBodyId.summary: NOTE Experimental The id read-only property of the interface returns a string identifying the intervention that generated the report. This can be used to group reports.

InterventionReportBodyLineNumber.summary: NOTE Experimental The lineNumber read-only property of the interface returns the line in the source file in which the intervention occurred.

blockquote.para: This property is most useful alongside as it enables the location of the line in that file where the feature is used.

InterventionReportBodyLineNumber.value: An integer, or null if the line is not known.

InterventionReportBodyMessage.summary: NOTE Experimental The message read-only property of the interface returns a human-readable description of the intervention, including information such as how the intervention could be avoided. This typically matches the message a browser will display in its DevTools console when an intervention is imposed, if one is available.

InterventionReportBodySourceFile.summary: NOTE Experimental The sourceFile read-only property of the interface returns the path to the source file where the intervention occurred.

blockquote.para: This property can be used with and to locate the column and line in the file where the feature is used.

InterventionReportBodySourceFile.value: A string, or null if the path is not known.

InterventionReportBodyToJSON.summary: NOTE Experimental The toJSON() method of the interface is a serializer, and returns a JSON representation of the InterventionReportBody object.
InterventionReportBodyToJSON.returns: A JSON object that is the serialization of the object.
